definitions.definition: An irregular line left from smearing or motion.
definitions.example: The picture I took out the car window had streaks.

definitions.definition: A continuous series of like events.
definitions.example: I hope I can keep up this streak of accomplishments.

definitions.definition: The color of the powder of a mineral. So called, because a simple field test for a mineral is to streak it against unglazed white porcelain.
A moth of the family Geometridae, Chesias legatella.
A tendency or characteristic, but not a dominant or pervasive one.
definitions.example: She's a quiet, bookish person, but she has a rebellious streak.

definitions.definition: A rung or round of a ladder.
The act of streaking, or running naked through a public area

definitions.example: If you clean a window in direct sunlight, it will streak.

definitions.definition: To run naked in public. (Contrast flash)
definitions.example: It was a pleasant game until some guy went streaking across the field.
You will streak a window by cleaning it in direct sunlight.

definitions.definition: To stretch; to extend; hence, to lay out, as a dead body.
